pull.title: cmake: Drop python dependency for translate
pull.body: Translate the `share/qt/extract_strings_qt.py` script to CMake. This removes the python dependency from the `translate` target.

events.body:

<!--5faf32d7da4f0f540f40219e4f7537a3-->

Concept ACK d3679017c64f336f94339373e563bd4967cd143c

PR moves functionality from python based script to cmake, which imho better aligns with the place from where the script is called (from a build) and it removes an external dependency. 

- build ✅
- followed translation instruction that calls the script ✅

Concept ACK.

> Translate the `share/qt/extract_strings_qt.py` script to CMake. This removes the python dependency from the `translate` target.

I [support](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33156#issue-3303948221) this PR approach:
> An alternative approach would be to convert the `translate` build target into a CMake script.

CI linter complains:
```
[11:39:00.061] File "share/qt/translate.cmake" contains a shebang line, but has the file permission 644 instead of the expected executable permission 755. Do "chmod 755 share/qt/translate.cmake" (or remove the shebang line).
```

> CI linter complains:
> 
> ```
> [11:39:00.061] File "share/qt/translate.cmake" contains a shebang line, but has the file permission 644 instead of the expected executable permission 755. Do "chmod 755 share/qt/translate.cmake" (or remove the shebang line).
> ```

What would you prefer:

a) Set executable bit, or
b) Remove shebang.

> > CI linter complains:
> > ```
> > [11:39:00.061] File "share/qt/translate.cmake" contains a shebang line, but has the file permission 644 instead of the expected executable permission 755. Do "chmod 755 share/qt/translate.cmake" (or remove the shebang line).
> > ```
> 
> What would you prefer:
> 
> a) Set executable bit, or
> b) Remove shebang.

(b), for consistency with other CMake scripts in the repository,

tree 8a00da90c7cdd867e43d6de729d0a6afa8b75175

author Daniel Pfeifer <daniel@pfeifer-mail.de> 1755504113 +0200
committer Daniel Pfeifer <daniel@pfeifer-mail.de> 1755520005 +0200

cmake: Drop python dependency for translate

events.message: cmake: Drop python dependency for translate

events.body:
<!--85328a0da195eb286784d51f73fa0af9-->
🚧 At least one of the CI tasks failed.
<sub>Task `lint`: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/runs/48299489270</sub>
<sub>LLM reason (✨ experimental): The CI failure is caused by incorrect file permissions on a script with a shebang line.</sub>

<details><summary>Hints</summary>

Try to run the tests locally, according to the documentation. However, a CI failure may still
happen due to a number of reasons, for example:

* Possibly due to a silent merge conflict (the changes in this pull request being
incompatible with the current code in the target branch). If so, make sure to rebase on the latest
commit of the target branch.

* A sanitizer issue, which can only be found by compiling with the sanitizer and running the
  affected test.

* An intermittent issue.

Leave a comment here, if you need help tracking down a confusing failure.

</details>

It seems no need to track `in_msgstr`:
```diff
--- a/share/qt/translate.cmake
+++ b/share/qt/translate.cmake
@@ -34,23 +34,20 @@ function(extract_strings output)
   set(messages)
   set(msgid)
   set(in_msgid OFF)
-  set(in_msgstr OFF)
 
   file(STRINGS "bitcoinstrings.text" text ENCODING "UTF-8")
   foreach(line IN LISTS text)
     if(line MATCHES "^msgid (.*)$")
-      if(in_msgstr AND NOT msgid STREQUAL "\"\"")
+      set(in_msgid ON)
+      set(msgid "${CMAKE_MATCH_1}")
+    elseif(line MATCHES "^msgstr (.*)$")
+      set(in_msgid OFF)
+      if(NOT msgid STREQUAL "\"\"")
         # CMake uses ';' as a list separator.
         # We need to temporarily replace that in order to keep strings intact.
         string(REPLACE ";" "<cmake-semicolon>" msgid "${msgid}")
         list(APPEND messages "${msgid}")
       endif()
-      set(in_msgid ON)
-      set(in_msgstr OFF)
-      set(msgid "${CMAKE_MATCH_1}")
-    elseif(line MATCHES "^msgstr (.*)$")
-      set(in_msgid OFF)
-      set(in_msgstr ON)
     elseif(line MATCHES "^\"")
       if(in_msgid)
         string(APPEND msgid "\n${line}")
@@ -58,11 +55,6 @@ function(extract_strings output)
     endif()
   endforeach()
 
-  if(in_msgstr AND NOT msgid STREQUAL "\"\"")
-    string(REPLACE ";" "<cmake-semicolon>" msgid "${msgid}")
-    list(APPEND messages "${msgid}")
-  endif()
-
   set(content [[// Automatically generated by translate.cmake
 
 #include <QtGlobal>
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -2,12 +2,13 @@
 # Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
 # file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
 
+cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.22)
comments.body: Can be dropped, given the global requirement in the root `CMakeLists.txt`?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -17,6 +18,78 @@ foreach(var IN LISTS input_variables)
   endif()
 endforeach()
 
+# Extract _("...") strings for translation and convert to Qt stringdefs so that
+# they can be picked up by Qt linguist.
+function(extract_strings output)
+  execute_process(
+    COMMAND ${XGETTEXT_EXECUTABLE}
+      --output=bitcoinstrings.text
+      --no-location
+      --from-code=utf-8
+      --keyword=_
+      ${ARGN}
+    COMMAND_ERROR_IS_FATAL ANY
+  )
+
+  set(messages)
+  set(msgid)
+  set(in_msgid OFF)
+  set(in_msgstr OFF)
+
+  file(STRINGS "bitcoinstrings.text" text ENCODING "UTF-8")
+  foreach(line IN LISTS text)
+    if(line MATCHES "^msgid (.*)$")
+      if(in_msgstr AND NOT msgid STREQUAL "\"\"")
+        # CMake uses ';' as a list separator.
+        # We need to temporarily replace that in orde to keep strings intact.
comments.body:
```suggestion
        # We need to temporarily replace that in order to keep strings intact.
```

(nit from the llm)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -2,12 +2,13 @@
 # Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
 # file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
 
+cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.22)
comments.body:
No. This is a script that is executed as a separate process. It does not inherit any settings from the buildsystem generator invocation.

I added a shebang to clarify that this may be used as an entrypoint.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -17,6 +18,78 @@ foreach(var IN LISTS input_variables)
   endif()
 endforeach()
 
+# Extract _("...") strings for translation and convert to Qt stringdefs so that
+# they can be picked up by Qt linguist.
+function(extract_strings output)
+  execute_process(
+    COMMAND ${XGETTEXT_EXECUTABLE}
+      --output=bitcoinstrings.text
+      --no-location
+      --from-code=utf-8
+      --keyword=_
+      ${ARGN}
+    COMMAND_ERROR_IS_FATAL ANY
+  )
+
+  set(messages)
+  set(msgid)
+  set(in_msgid OFF)
+  set(in_msgstr OFF)
+
+  file(STRINGS "bitcoinstrings.text" text ENCODING "UTF-8")
+  foreach(line IN LISTS text)
+    if(line MATCHES "^msgid (.*)$")
+      if(in_msgstr AND NOT msgid STREQUAL "\"\"")
+        # CMake uses ';' as a list separator.
+        # We need to temporarily replace that in orde to keep strings intact.

@@ -2,12 +2,13 @@
 # Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
 # file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
 
+cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.22)
comments.body: Just a nit, but I mentioned it, because we don't add it to any other script (cmake, python, bash, ...). They are simply documented in `doc/dependencies.md` and bumping them is done with a minimal patch, not touching all possible scripts that could be called as an entrypoint. Also, this protects against  an edge case, that  doesn't exist in reality: It requires a developer that uses an ancient cmake to call this entrypoint manually. But just a nit.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -17,6 +19,78 @@ foreach(var IN LISTS input_variables)
   endif()
 endforeach()
 
+# Extract _("...") strings for translation and convert to Qt stringdefs so that
+# they can be picked up by Qt linguist.
+function(extract_strings output)
+  execute_process(
+    COMMAND ${XGETTEXT_EXECUTABLE}
+      --output=bitcoinstrings.text
+      --no-location
+      --from-code=utf-8
+      --keyword=_
+      ${ARGN}
+    COMMAND_ERROR_IS_FATAL ANY
+  )
+
+  set(messages)
+  set(msgid)
+  set(in_msgid OFF)
+  set(in_msgstr OFF)
+
+  file(STRINGS "bitcoinstrings.text" text ENCODING "UTF-8")
+  foreach(line IN LISTS text)
+    if(line MATCHES "^msgid (.*)$")
+      if(in_msgstr AND NOT msgid STREQUAL "\"\"")
+        # CMake uses ';' as a list separator.
+        # We need to temporarily replace that in order to keep strings intact.
+        string(REPLACE ";" "<cmake-semicolon>" msgid "${msgid}")
+        list(APPEND messages "${msgid}")
+      endif()
+      set(in_msgid ON)
+      set(in_msgstr OFF)
+      set(msgid "${CMAKE_MATCH_1}")
+    elseif(line MATCHES "^msgstr (.*)$")
+      set(in_msgid OFF)
+      set(in_msgstr ON)
+    elseif(line MATCHES "^\"")
+      if(in_msgid)
+        string(APPEND msgid "\n${line}")
+      endif()
+    endif()
+  endforeach()
+
+  if(in_msgstr AND NOT msgid STREQUAL "\"\"")
+    string(REPLACE ";" "<cmake-semicolon>" msgid "${msgid}")
+    list(APPEND messages "${msgid}")
+  endif()
+
+  set(content [[// Automatically generated by translate.cmake
+
+#include <QtGlobal>
+
+#ifdef __GNUC__
+#  define UNUSED __attribute__((unused))
comments.body:
Nit, Both `#define` lines are a change in the `#ifdef` style (also from the previous generated file). Personally I do not care which style is followed. Just noting that this is a derivation. 
 
```suggestion
#define UNUSED __attribute__((unused))
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -2,12 +2,13 @@
 # Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
 # file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
 
+cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.22)
comments.body: This also sets the [policy version](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/command/cmake_minimum_required.html#policy-version). No matter what version of CMake you use, it will behave as if you used 3.22.
